column2: A simple earthen hillfort will provide limited defence against our enemies.
Ditches around the outside of the hillfort will impede enemy attacks.
With wooden walls our hillfort will provide even more defence.
Smaller and tighter palisades will make our hillfort more resistant to attack.
Reinforcing our wooden palisades with stone will strengthen the fort.
Multiple layers of defence will provide strong defence against our enemies.
With the use of stone walls our hillfort will stand strong.
Our hillfort has stands as a imposing, formidable fortress.
While somehwat rundown, this former Roman fort still provides a decent fortification for the area.
This former Roman fort has been fully restored and provides a formidable defence to the province.
Establishing a permanent hamlet in our settlement is essential in order to improve our trade.
The hamlet has grown into a small village in the settlement.
A small market in the village will enhance trade in the province.
Further expanding the village to a town will allow even more inhabitants to settle down to improve our trade.

As the town grows, so does the flow of merchants and the trade that comes along with them.\n§Y25%§! chance of creating a city upon adopting an urban government, if there are currently no cities in the province.

With some coin, the town will grow into a city with many traders and will improve our trade.\n§Y50%§! chance of creating a city upon adopting an urban government, if there are currently no cities in the province.

The city will grow large and hold many trade posts, as any trade centre ought to.\n§Y75%§! chance of creating a city upon adopting an urban government, if there are currently no cities in the province.
Merchants from far and wide frequent this thriving city.\n§Y100%§! chance of creating a city upon adopting an urban government, if there are currently no cities in the province.
